Hey Jared,

Nothing to be embarrassed about, it's an obscure failure that's=
 always hard
to debug.  Glad you figured it out.

-- 
Cedric
http://testng.=
org


On 10/19/06, Jared Warren <jared.warren@...> wrote:
>
> *insert=
 official embarassment here*
>
> Just as I got your reply, I dug further ba=
ck in the test logs and found a
> call to the ImageIcon constructor in the =
enum static initialization (just
> as
> you predicted.)  The files referenc=
ed in the constructor weren't being
> copied into the classpath until after=
 the tests were being run (d'oh),
> thus
> the static initialization block =
threw an exception and future attempts to
> load the class threw the NoClas=
sDefFoundError.
>
> Thanks for your help!
> j.
>
> On 10/19/06, C=C3=A9dric=
 Beust =E2=99=94 <cbeust@...> wrote:
> >
> >   On 10/18/06, Jared Wa=
rren <jared.warren@...<
> jared.warren%40gmail.com>>
> > wrote:
> > >=

> > > Yeah, that's certainly what I thought....
> > >
> > > But all of my =
other tests pass, and the classes are all generated by
> the
> > > same com=
piler call, and the "destdir" is the same for all of them. (In
> > > fact, =
the stack trace includes classes that are in the same package
> and
> > > d=
irectory as the 'enum' that's causing the NoClassDefFoundError to be
> > > =
thrown.
> >
> > Not sure what else to tell you, except to point out that yo=
u're looking
> at
> > at NoClassDefFound, and not ClassNotFound.
> >
> > No=
ClassDefFound is typically thrown when a class can't complete its
> > initi=
alization (for example, in a static block). Do you have static
> > blocks? =
Are they referencing external classes?
